thread.title: The Flash Will Debut New DC Comics Hero In Upcoming Episode
thread.title_full: The Flash Will Debut New DC Comics Hero In Upcoming Episode

author: Jay Jayson
title: The Flash Will Debut New DC Comics Hero In Upcoming Episode
text:
The Flash Will Debut New DC Comics Hero In Upcoming Episode Jay Jayson Back to Article Image of 
Back in December, someone donning a costume that resembles the one Earth-19 (where H.R. comes from) speedster the Accelerated Man wears was spotted on the set of The Flash . He wore a red pilot’s suit and matching cap with goggles, as well as yellow boots and gloves and a white belt and mouth covering. 
Up until now, we weren't 100% sure if it was the Accelerated Man or when this costumed-character would appear in the show. However, now that The CW has released stills (along with captions) from "Attack on Central City," we know Accelerated Man will appear in this Tuesday's episode and be played by Sean Poague — an actor that has appeared in The Man in the High Castle and Sandra Brown's White Hot . 
Below, you can check out the first official photo of Accelerated Man. 
Earth-19 is the Earth of the DC Comics multiverse where the story in the popular Gotham by Gaslight graphic novel, DC Comics' first ever Elseworlds tale, took place. Earth-19 is an Earth where superheroes appeared during the Industrial Revolution of the Edwardian era, which would explain the Accelerated Man's dated look and unusual name. 
BARRY TURNS TO THE SPEED FORCE – Desperate to stop Savitar and save his friends, Barry (Grant Gustin) turns to the Speed Force for answers. H.R. (Tom Cavanagh) gives Jesse (Violett Beane) some advice. 
Gregory Smith directed the episode written by Brooke Roberts & Judalina Neira. 
MORE: New Poster Teases Gorilla Grodd, The Flash Showdown / The Flash: Comparing Gorilla City to Its Comics Counterpart / The Flash Recap With Spoilers: Attack on Gorilla City 
Based on the characters from DC, The Flash is from by Bonanza Productions Inc. in association with Berlanti Productions and Warner Bros. Television, with executive producers Greg Berlanti ( Arrow, Supergirl ), Andrew Kreisberg ( Arrow, The Flash ), Sarah Schechter ( Arrow, DC’s Legends of Tomorrow ) and Aaron and Todd Helbing. 
The Flash airs Tuesday nights at 8 p.m. ET/PT on The CW . ComicBook Composite 90.02 #3 All-Time Comic TV Shows Average rating
